segment.source: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.
segment.target: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.

segment.source: Link to your app
segment.target: Link to your app

segment.source: Link to your app
segment.target: Link to your app

segment.source: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.
segment.target: You can help customers discover your app by linking to your app's Store listing.

segment.source: Getting the link to your app's Store listing
segment.target: Getting the link to your app's Store listing

segment.source: You can find the link to your app's Store listing on the App identity page, in the App management section of each app in your dashboard.
segment.target: You can find the link to your app's Store listing on the App identity page, in the App management section of each app in your dashboard.

segment.source: This link is in the format
segment.target: This link is in the format

segment.source: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.
segment.target: When a customer clicks this link, it will open the web-based listing page for your app.

segment.source: If your app is available for the customer's device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.
segment.target: If your app is available for the customer's device, the Store app will also launch and display your app's listing.

segment.source: Note Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.
segment.target: Note Depending on what OS versions you're targeting, you may see more than one link here.

segment.source: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10, which will work for any OS.
segment.target: All apps will show the URL for Windows 10, which will work for any OS.

segment.source: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.
segment.target: You may see additional links for Windows 8.1 and earlier and/or Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, which will work only on the specified OS versions.

segment.source: Linking to your app's Store listing with the Windows Store badge
segment.target: Linking to your app's Store listing with the Windows Store badge

segment.source: You can link directly to your app's listing with a custom badge to let customers know your app is in the Windows Store.
segment.target: You can link directly to your app's listing with a custom badge to let customers know your app is in the Windows Store.

segment.source: To create your badge, visit the Windows Store badges page.
segment.target: To create your badge, visit the Windows Store badges page.

segment.source: You'll need to have your app's Product ID to use this form to generate the badge and link.
segment.target: You'll need to have your app's Product ID to use this form to generate the badge and link.

segment.source: This ID is the last 12 characters of the URL for Windows 10 shown on the App identity page in the App management section.
segment.target: This ID is the last 12 characters of the URL for Windows 10 shown on the App identity page in the App management section.

segment.source: Note See App marketing guidelines for more info on using the Windows Store badge.
segment.target: Note See App marketing guidelines for more info on using the Windows Store badge.

segment.source: Linking directly to your app in the Windows Store
segment.target: Linking directly to your app in the Windows Store

segment.source: You can create a link that launches the Windows Store and goes directly to your app's listing page without opening a browser by using the ms-windows-store: URI scheme.
segment.target: You can create a link that launches the Windows Store and goes directly to your app's listing page without opening a browser by using the ms-windows-store: URI scheme.

segment.source: These links are useful if you know your users are on a Windows device and you want them to arrive directly at the listing page in the Store—for example, after checking user agent strings in a browser to confirm the user's operating system, or when you are already communicating via a UWP app, you may want to apply this protocol.
segment.target: These links are useful if you know your users are on a Windows device and you want them to arrive directly at the listing page in the Store—for example, after checking user agent strings in a browser to confirm the user's operating system, or when you are already communicating via a UWP app, you may want to apply this protocol.

segment.source: To use the Windows Store protocol to link directly to your app's Store listing, append your app's Product ID to this link:
segment.target: To use the Windows Store protocol to link directly to your app's Store listing, append your app's Product ID to this link:

segment.source: For more about using the Windows Store protocol, see Launch the Windows Store app.
segment.target: For more about using the Windows Store protocol, see Launch the Windows Store app.
